LDAP Chai API

SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.novell.ldapchai
Interface ChaiEntry

All Known Subinterfaces:
ChaiGroup, ChaiUser
public interface ChaiEntry

ChaiEntry instances represent ldap entries. Most other Chai* interfaces in this package inherit from ChaiEntry. Each instance wraps a ldap distinguished name (DN) value that it then uses for all subsequent operations. Methods are provided to easily access or modify attributes of the entry, as well as to find related objects. Clients can consume ChaiEntry instances as if they were beans baacked by some persistant store.

This interface is extended by several sub-interfaces that provide added functionality for specific entry types such as users and groups.

This interface and its sub-interfaces are intended to be the primary interface that callers to the LDAP Chai API reference in their code.

Instances of ChaiEntry can be obtained by using ChaiFactory.

Author:
Jason D. Rivard

Method Detail

addAttribute

void addAttribute(String attributeName,
                  String attributeValue)
                  throws ChaiOperationException,
                         ChaiUnavailableException
Writes an additional attribute value to an attribute on an ldap entry. This operation will not overwrite any existing values. If the attribute has no values already, the supplied value will be set.

Duplicate values are not permitted by ldap. An attempt to add duplicate values will result in an ChaiOperationException with ChaiError.

Parameters:
attributeName - A valid attribute for the entry
attributeValue - A string value to be added to the ldap entry
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
See Also:
com.novell.ldapchai.provider.ChaiProvider#writeStringAttribute(String, String, java.util.List, boolean)

                  Set<String> attributeValues)

                         ChaiUnavailableException

Duplicate values are not permitted by ldap. An attempt to add duplicate values will result in an ChaiOperationException with ChaiError.

Parameters:

See Also:

compareStringAttribute

boolean compareStringAttribute(String attributeName,
                               String attributeValue)
                               throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                                      ChaiOperationException
Compares a pre-existing attribute value in the ldap directory. Most ChaiProvider implementations will do this using the ldap COMPARE command, so the check is done on the server side.

Parameters:
attributeName - A valid attribute for the entry
attributeValue - A string value to be tested against the ldap entry
Returns:
true if the value exists in the ldap directory
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
See Also:
ChaiProvider.compareStringAttribute(String,String,String)

                     String attributeValue)
                     throws ChaiOperationException,
                            ChaiUnavailableException

Parameters:

attributeValue - A particular value to delete, or null for all values
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
See Also:

getChildObjects

Set<ChaiEntry> getChildObjects()
                               throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                                      ChaiOperationException
Finds any decendents of this entry in the ldap heirarchy

Returns:
A set of all decendents. If no decendants are found, an empty set is returned.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

Returns:
DN of the object.

getParentEntry

ChaiEntry getParentEntry()
                         throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                                ChaiOperationException
Finds the parent entry of this instance's entry in the directory.

Returns:
An ChaiEntryImpl representing the parent entry. If there is no parent, then null is returned.
Throws:
ChaiUnavailableException
ChaiOperationException

isValid

boolean isValid()
Indicates if the instance of this object actually references a live object in the directory. If any error happens during this operation (such as a ChaiUnavailableException is thrown), the error is swallowed and false is returned.

Returns:
true if the object exists in the directory.

readBooleanAttribute

boolean readBooleanAttribute(String attributeName)
                             throws ChaiOperationException,
                                    ChaiUnavailableException
A convience method for reading boolean values from the ldap directory. Note that ldap booleans actually have three states: true, false and does not exist. This method uses the general convention that does not exist is treated as false.

Parameters:
attributeName - The name of the attribute
Returns:
true if value is "true", false if it is any other value or does not exist.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

readCanonicalDN

String readCanonicalDN()
                       throws ChaiOperationException,
                              ChaiUnavailableException
Read the canonical distinguish name (DN). This method will issue an LDAP search operation to retrieve the DN value of the the entry as defined by the LDAP server. The returned value may differ from getEntryDN() in terms of case, spacing, or other syntax differences, however they should resolve to the same entry by the ldap server.

Canonical values are particularly useful when storing in a collection, as you can gaurentee that two

Returns:
The canonical DN of the object, as returned by the LDAP server
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

readDateAttribute

Date readDateAttribute(String attributeName)
                       throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                              ChaiOperationException
Read an attribute with timestamp value. Automatically converts the timestamp to a Date object. If there are any problems with the conversion, null is returned.

Parameters:
attributeName - Name of the attribute to read. Date must be in Zulu string format.
Returns:
A valid Date object, or null if a date can not be determined.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

                     throws ChaiOperationException,
                            ChaiUnavailableException

Parameters:
attributeName - The name of the attribute.
Returns:
int value of attribute, or zero if it does not exist or is not numeric
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

readMultiByteAttribute

byte[][] readMultiByteAttribute(String attributeName)
                                throws ChaiOperationException,
                                       ChaiUnavailableException
Performs a read operation against the directory and returns the binary results. Useful only for ldap attributes using binary syntax type.

Parameters:
attributeName - A valid attribute on the object.
Returns:
A byte array where the first dimension is each ldap value, and the second diminsion is the actual byte values.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If an error is encountered during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
See Also:
ChaiProvider.readMultiByteAttribute(String,String)

readMultiStringAttribute

Set<String> readMultiStringAttribute(String attributeName)
                                     throws ChaiOperationException,
                                            ChaiUnavailableException
Retreives an attribute value from the LDAP entry represented by the instance of this class. If the attribute syntax is not a string, the value will be converted to a string.

Callers of this method should use the values specified in the ChaiConstant class when possible.

Parameters:
attributeName - The name of the atttribute
Returns:
Values of the attribute selected.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

readNetAddressAttribute

List<InetAddress> readNetAddressAttribute(String attributeName)
                                          throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                                                 ChaiOperationException
Read an attribute with network address value. Reads attributes with network address syntax, and returns any IP addresses found there. Addresses of other types are ignored.

Parameters:
attributeName - Name of the attribute to read. Date must be in Zulu string format.
Returns:
A valid Date object, or null if a date can not be determined.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

                            throws ChaiOperationException,
                                   ChaiUnavailableException

Returns:
The value(s) of the attribute, or null if no value
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

readStringAttribute

String readStringAttribute(String attributeName)
                           throws ChaiOperationException,
                                  ChaiUnavailableException
Retreives an attribute value from the LDAP entry represented by the instance of this class. If the attribute has multiple values then only a single value is returned. If the attribute does not have a string syntax, the value will be converted to a string.

Callers of this method should use the values specified in the ChaiConstant class when possible.

Parameters:
attributeName - The name of the attribute
Returns:
Value of the attributeName attribute
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
See Also:
ChaiProvider.readStringAttribute(String,String)

readStringAttributes

Map<String,String> readStringAttributes(Set<String> attributes)
                                        throws ChaiOperationException,
                                               ChaiUnavailableException
Read an array of specified attributes. If any of the attributes has multiple values, only the first value returned by the directory is returned. If the attribute does not have a string syntax, the value will be converted to a string.

Callers of this method are encouraged to use the values specified in ChaiConstant when possible for attribute names.

Parameters:
attributes - Valid attributes on the object.
Returns:
A map containing the result of the read
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
See Also:
readStringAttribute(String), ChaiProvider.readStringAttributes(String, java.util.Set)

replaceAttribute

void replaceAttribute(String attributeName,
                      String oldValue,
                      String newValue)
                      throws ChaiOperationException,
                             ChaiUnavailableException
Replace an existing an attriubte value with a new value. This operation is useful for manipulating multi-valued attributes, and is less expensive then first deleting an existing value and then adding a new value.

Parameters:
attributeName - The name of the attribute
oldValue - The old value
newValue - The new value
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
See Also:
ChaiProvider.replaceStringAttribute(String,String,String,String)

search

Set<ChaiEntry> search(String filter)
                      throws ChaiOperationException,
                             ChaiUnavailableException
Perform an ldap search using this entry as the search root. A subtree search is implied, and no attribute values are requested. The result is a collection of ChaiEntry instances that can then be further minipulated.

Parameters:
filter - A valid RFC2254 ldap search filter
Returns:
Set ChaiEntry objects that mean the search criteria
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
See Also:
ChaiProvider.search(String, com.novell.ldapchai.util.SearchHelper), ChaiProvider.searchMultiValues(String, com.novell.ldapchai.util.SearchHelper)

search

Set<ChaiEntry> search(SearchHelper searchHelper)
                      throws ChaiOperationException,
                             ChaiUnavailableException
Perform an ldap search using this entry as the search root. A SearchHelper is required and its values are used to perform the search. The result is a collection of ChaiEntry instances that can then be further minipulated.

Note, although the SearchHelper can specify return attributes, the attributes are not requested using this search method. Instead, the result ChaiEntries can be used to read attribute values.

Parameters:
searchHelper - A search helper instance
Returns:
Set ChaiEntry objects that mean the search criteria
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
See Also:
ChaiProvider.search(String, com.novell.ldapchai.util.SearchHelper), ChaiProvider.searchMultiValues(String, com.novell.ldapchai.util.SearchHelper)

search

Set<ChaiEntry> search(String filter,
                      ChaiProvider.SEARCH_SCOPE searchScope)
                      throws ChaiOperationException,
                             ChaiUnavailableException
Perform an ldap search using this entry as the search root. No attribute values are requested. The result is a collection of ChaiEntry instances that can then be further minipulated.

Parameters:
filter - A valid RFC2254 ldap search filter
searchScope - The scope to use during the search operation
Returns:
Set ChaiEntry objects that mean the search criteria
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
See Also:
ChaiProvider.search(String, com.novell.ldapchai.util.SearchHelper), ChaiProvider.searchMultiValues(String, com.novell.ldapchai.util.SearchHelper)

readGUID

String readGUID()
                throws ChaiOperationException,
                       ChaiUnavailableException
Read a GUID (Globally Unique Identifier) from the entry. Chai will attempt to use vendor-specific attributes for the entry. Many vendor implementations store GUID values as binary, or octet-length syntax so this method will automatically convert to a string format of some type, typically a hex or base64 string. Thus, the value returned by this method can be assumed to be unique per entry and reliably read across time, however the value may not be easily reversable to the original vendor format.

Returns:
Value of the entry's vendor-specific GUID format in some type of string format, or null if not available
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
UnsupportedOperationException - If the vendor implementation does not have a GUID
